definition.name: NXresolution
definition.doc: Describes the resolution of a physical quantity.

field.name: physical_quantity
field.doc: The physical quantity of the resolution, e.g., energy, momentum, time, etc.

field.name: type
field.doc: The process by which the resolution was determined.

group.name: note
group.doc: Additional details of the estimate or description of the calibration procedure

field.name: resolution
field.doc: The resolution of the physical quantity.

field.name: resolution_errors
field.doc: Standard deviation of the resolution of the physical quantity.

field.name: relative_resolution
field.doc: Ratio of the resolution at a specified measurand value to that measurand value,

field.name: relative_resolution_errors
field.doc: Standard deviation of the relative resolution of the physical quantity.

group.name: response_function
group.doc: The response of the instrument or part to a infinitesimally sharp input signal along the physical quantity of this group. This is also sometimes called instrument response function for time resolution or point spread function for spatial response. The resolution is typically determined by taking the full width at half maximum (FWHM) of the response function.

field.name: input
field.doc: The input axis or grid of the response function. The unit should match the one of the resolution field.

field.name: magnitude
field.doc: The magnitude of the response function corresponding to the points in the input axis or grid. This field should have the same dimensions as `input`.

field.name: formula_SYMBOL
field.doc: A symbol linking to another path in this appdef to be referred to from the `resolution_formula` field. This should be a valid path inside this application definition, i.e., of the form /entry/instrument/my_part/my_field.

field.name: resolution_formula
field.doc: A resolution formula to determine the resolution from a set of symbols as entered by the `formula_...` fields. The output unit should match the provided unit of this field.

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which child group contains a path leading to a :ref:`NXdata` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.

group.doc: For storing details and data of a calibration to derive a resolution from data.
